awd_abstract_narration: This is a project in medium-energy nuclear theory at the                   University of Pittsburgh.  Studies of antinucleon-nucleon and                   meson electroproduction reactions, the effects of                               intermediate-state resonances, isobar excitation and short-                     range quark interactions using the momentum-space approach                      developed by the principal investigator will be pursued.  Spin                  observables play a fundamental part in studying these effects.                       In electroproduction, investigations of K+                                 photoproduction as a source of new information about the                        formation of N* resonances will be carried out.  Our coupled-                   channels antinucleon code will be adapted to photoproduction                    processes and used to study reactions that relate to possible                   work at CEBAF.  The effect of multistep reactions will be                       studied.  Particular attention will be paid to the resulting                    spin observables.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
